III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Criminal history check, subject to requirements; staff qualifications
Title
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4112 Criminal history check, subject to
Section requirements; staff qualifications.
Description (4) A person with ongoing duties shall have both of the following:
(a) Ability to perform duties of the position assigned.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On a recent unknown date, Youth A asked for her room to be
sprayed. The staff sprayed Youth A and told her that her room
stinks, and she needs to take more showers. The concern is with
the staff that sprayed Youth A. The staff 's name is unknown. It is
unknown what was being sprayed. It is unknown where on Youth
A's body she was sprayed. This is an ongoing treatment between
the staff and Youth A.
Investigation Administrator was interviewed via phone on 6/3/2024. She
reported being informed of the allegations by Supervisor after
Youth A informed Supervisor of the allegations. Administrator
reported there was a language gap between Youth A and Staff 2
because Youth A speaks French and Staff 2 speaks Spanish with
very limited English.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on
6/3/2024. Youth A’s room was observed prior to the interview and
nothing out of regulation was found. An interpreter was used
because Youth A is unable to speak or understand English. Youth
A was unaware of the reason for the interview. Youth A had asked
Staff 2 to spray the carpet in the bedroom and when spraying the
carpet, Staff 2 sprayed Youth A head to toe. Youth A asked Staff 2
why Staff 2 sprayed Youth A and Staff 2 responded by saying
maybe Youth A is the one making the smell. Youth A believed this
is what Staff 2 said. Youth A reported the incident occurred on
Thursday, 5/30/24, at approximately 8:00pm. Youth A reported
Staff 2 dislikes Youth A and that there were no other youth or staff
present at the time. Youth A reported Staff 2 doesn’t take Youth A
on outings, but other staff will do so. Youth A reported feeling safe
at the facility and has staff and other youth, Youth A can speak
with when struggling emotionally.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face at the facility on 6/3/2024
and via phone on 6/4/2024. She reported having no knowledge
of any issues with Staff 2’s performance at the facility. She
2

reported staff use a disinfectant spray but was unable to recall the
name.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on 6/4/2024. An interpreter
was used because Staff 2 has a very limited English vocabulary.
She reported Youth A asked Staff 2 to spray the bedroom
because of a smell. The communication between Staff 2 and
Youth A involved pointing and making signs and gestures to let
Staff 2 know the issue and where to spray. Staff 2 reported not
knowing of any procedures for a correct way to spray such as
having Youth A leave the room. Staff 2 reported spraying
everywhere Youth A pointed and accidently sprayed Youth A’s
feet when Staff 2 turned to spray behind herself, and Youth A was
standing very close behind Staff 2. Staff 2 reported telling Youth A
that Staff 2 was sorry but could only say this in Spanish not
French. Staff 2 reported Youth A said something in French and
Staff 2 believed the incident was not a big deal. Staff 1 denied
saying anything about Youth A smelling or needing a shower. In
regard to the errands with Youth A, Staff 2 reported she will offer
outings to all the youth that are on the appropriate level. Youth A
has refused to participate in the outings when offered. Staff 2
reported other youth also refuse to go on outing at times. Staff 2
denied showing favoritism with youth.
Staff 3 was interviewed via phone on 6/4/2024. She reported
working with Staff 2 and never observing Staff 2 show any
favoritism with any youth. Staff 2 offers outing to all of the youth.
Staff 3 reported the only instructions about spraying is that the
youth are not allowed to spray and only tell the staff where the
smell is so staff can spray the area. Staff 3 has never witnessed
Staff 2 being inappropriate with the youth and she believes the
spray is something like “Febreze”.
Youth B was interviewed via phone on 6/4/2024. An interpreter
was used because Youth B has very limited English. Youth B
reported never witnessing Staff 1 being inappropriate with youth
and doesn’t believe Staff 1 shows favoritism with youth. Youth B
also reported all staff offer outings to all the youth and some youth
will decline to go.
Youth C was interviewed via phone on 6/4/2024. An interpreter
was used because Youth C has very limited English. Youth C
reported never witnessing Staff 1 nor any other staff mistreat
youth. She reported all youth are invited on outings and some
decline. Youth C reported staff will use Febreze to spray for smells
in the rooms.
3

Supervisor was interviewed via phone on 6/24/2024. She
reported not witnessing the incident but was told by Youth A the
day after the incident. After speaking with Administrator, it was
determined to call the allegations into MDHHS even though there
was no suspicion of abuse or neglect. Youth A informed
Supervisor, Staff 1 sprayed Youth A’s feet while spraying the
bedroom for smells. Supervisor reported staff use a spray with a
citrus smell to get rid of odors. Youth A informed Supervisor that
there were no witnesses to the incident with Staff 1. Supervisor
reported there is a communication issue between Staff 1 and
Youth A. In regard to the allegations of not being allowed to go on
errands, Supervisor reported Youth A is not on a high enough
statues within the program to go on shopping trips (errands) but is
able to go on outing such as the park or Y-center. She reported
never witnessing or being made aware of Staff 1 not inviting or
excluding Youth A.
Documents Reviewed:
UAC Basic Information incident report dated 5/31/24 for the
event documented as occurring on 5/30/24 involving Youth A.
The event is documented as reported by Supervisor’s interview
with Youth A. Youth A requested the room be sprayed for smell
and after spraying the room, Youth A again requested the room be
sprayed and it is documented that during the second spraying that
Youth A reported Staff 1 sprayed Youth A’s feet. Youth A reported
saying that Staff 1 told Youth A that Youth A needs to shower
more often. Youth A reported Staff 1 doesn’t take Youth A on
errands. It is documented that Youth A declined to meet with Staff
1 to discuss the allegations and come to a resolution. Supervisor
documented speaking to Staff 1 who denied saying anything
about a shower to Youth A. Staff 1 is documented as being very
apologetic about spraying Youth A’s feet.
Bellaview Transitional Living Center Policies & Procedures –
Staff conduct, and Expectations dated 7/11/23. This document
outlines the expected behaviors from staff when dealing with
youth in the program. Staff are expected to observe standards of
professionalism, honesty, and responsible behavior. Staff are also
expected to serve as positive role models and demonstrate
common courtesy towards youth. Staff are expected to show
youth mutual respect at all times.
Staff 2’s personnel file: Documentation indicates Staff 2 was
hired in 1/1/2024 and there is no disciplinary action documents in
4

the file. Documentation in the file indicates Staff 2 completed
professionalism training on 4/24/24, Code of conduct training on
3/29/24, and essential elements of trauma informed care on
3/28/24. Staff 2 is current on all training requirements.
Analysis The agency is found in compliance with staff qualifications as Staff
2 admitted to accidentally spraying Youth A’s feet with spray.
Youth A originally stated staff only sprayed her feet and later
stated she was sprayed from head to toe. It is noted there is a
communication barrier between the staff and youth that may have
contributed to the concern. Additionally, per interviews with staff
and youth, Youth A is offered the same activities or outings as
other youth based on her level.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
